abstract: Italian Senate is expected to begin voting on legislation to legalize civil unions for gays and lesbians; country remains outlier in Western world with respect to same-sex marriage or civil unions, in large part because of continuing influence of Roman Catholic Church; while passage of legislation initially seemed certain, doubts have been raised, as issue could split governing coalition.
lead_paragraph: Years after a similar effort failed, lawmakers are confronting an issue that remains a wide divide between Italy and most of the rest of the West.

headline.main: Italy Divided Over Effort to Legalize Civil Unions for Gays
headline.print_headline: Italy Divided Over Allowing Civil Unions

snippet: Years after a similar effort failed, lawmakers are confronting an issue that remains a wide divide between Italy and most of the rest of the West.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
